feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued April 02 at 5:07AM AKDT until April 03 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Winds gusting to 50 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow. Significant drifting snow is likely. Cold wind chills to 50 below zero are occurring.

Large snow drifts will form. Blowing snow may briefly reduce

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 8:52AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds Sunday Increasing on Monday... A series of disturbances will bring increased winds Sunday afternoon and evening, with stronger winds Monday afternoon and evening. For Sunday, westerly gusts of 25 to 40 mph are expected with a few higher gusts possible in wind prone locations. For Monday, there is potential for westerly gusts of 35 to 45 mph,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 12:17PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Levy County through 1245 PM EDT... At 1216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 9 miles southwest of Bronson, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 12:16PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Bradford, northeastern Alachua, northeastern Marion, northwestern Putnam and southwestern Clay Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Alachua to near Rochelle to near Orange Springs. Movement was northeast at 35 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 12:02PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Citrus and southern Levy Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1201 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 28 miles south of Fowlers Bluff, or 35 miles west of Homosassa Springs, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 11:10AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Moderate To Heavy Snow Continues... Snow continues to move eastward across portions of far northeast Iowa and into northwest Illinois through midday. Some of the snow was heavy and reducing visibility down to a half mile or less in areas. In addition, the heavy snowfall rates were producing snow and slush covered roads north of Highway 30, especially secondary
